articles.title: Senate Narrowly Approves Massive Bill to Gut Social Programs and Cut Taxes on the Rich
articles.description: The U.S. Senate passed a sweeping bill that includes tax breaks for the wealthy and significant cuts to social programs like Medicaid and food assistance. Vice President JD Vance cast the tie-breaking vote. The legislation also increases funding for deportation efforts, deregulates AI and cryptocurrency, and ends subsidies for renewable energy.

articles.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Acquitted on Most Serious Charges, Denied Bail
articles.description: Hip-hop mogul Sean 'Diddy' Combs was acquitted of sex trafficking and racketeering charges but convicted on two lesser counts related to prostitution. Despite the mixed verdict, which some view as a legal victory, the judge denied him bail, meaning he will remain in custody.

articles.title: Seven Missing After Fireworks Warehouse Explosion in California
articles.description: Seven people are missing following a massive explosion and fire that destroyed a commercial fireworks facility in rural Northern California. The incident occurred on Tuesday evening, with aerial footage showing the building completely leveled.
